source.author: Entwisle, T.J.; Maslin, B.R.; Cowan, R.S.; Court, A.B.
source.title: Mimosaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J.; Maslin, B.R.; Cowan, R.S.; Court, A.B. (1996). Mimosaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Phyllodes 5–20 cm long, 5–15 mm wide, more than 7 times as long as broad, mostly thin and pliable, mostly dark-green; pods mostly straight; near-coastal and hinterland
Phyllodes 5–12 cm long, 10–30 mm wide, less than 5 times as long as broad, often thick and sometimes fleshy, usually yellow-green; pods mostly coiled or contorted; mostly coastal
